62e48e0f1e12.title: GarPax is a big problem for this team.

paragraphs.text: GarPax is a big problem for this team. Signing Rondo was not a good move. Then it is Hoiberg. I don’t mind having DWade on the team but he can’t start. He is good for the young guys and Jimmy as well. But you CAN’T have a starting five that can’t shoot!! This is dumb!! We have the roster to compete on a regular basis but Hoiberg doesn’t put them out…

d89392c99eed.title: Hoiberg’s success at ISU was based on one big who could step out and shoot 3s, and four wings who…

paragraphs.text: Hoiberg’s success at ISU was based on one big who could step out and shoot 3s, and four wings who were either slashers or 3 point shooters (preferably both). He has yet to have the roster in Chicago to fit his style: his “inconsistent” rotation is due to his efforts to find a rotation that works consistently. It’s almost as if the front office is…

22fb940fcd6e.title: Though Hoiberg has yet to prove he’s an NBA caliber coach, IMO the blame falls more on Forman …

paragraphs.text: Though Hoiberg has yet to prove he’s an NBA caliber coach, IMO the blame falls more on Forman & Paxson. Their free agent acquisitions & trades (Rondo, Wade, Rose for Lopez, even Pau) have undermined strong drafting of players that can actually play & thrive in Hoiberg’s system (Portis, McDermott, Valentine, Mirotic, Zipser, Felicio).

81608be1cf99.title: Simple solution — Get rid of GarPax!

paragraphs.text: Simple solution — Get rid of GarPax! Those guys are straight buffoons! They can’t attract big name free agents, they have overvalued our players throughout the years & can seldom can pull off a significant trade. They’ve been on borrowed time the last 5 years but with Jerry ReinsDORK as the owner they stick around. Da Mules need some Cubbie magic but…
paragraphs.name: c99c

712286a8138a.title: I would have been much happier to see them keep Rose and play their young guys.

paragraphs.text: I would have been much happier to see them keep Rose and play their young guys. Then, move on from Rose in FA and put that $ to use in building something around Jimmy. Of course knowing this management, they would have kept Rose and traded Butler in that scenario.

eba9fa779b94.title: Jerry Reinsdorf is a terrible owner.

paragraphs.text: Jerry Reinsdorf is a terrible owner. Both the White Sox and Bulls have been directionless for years.

dc3c94d2cc20.title: Perhaps the saddest thing about the Chicago Bulls is that they’re wasting Butler’s prime years.

paragraphs.text: Perhaps the saddest thing about the Chicago Bulls is that they’re wasting Butler’s prime years. He isn’t old — at 27 he still has plenty of prime years left — but it doesn’t seem likely that this team will be in a much better position to maximize his value in the next two or three years.
paragraphs.name: 1f34

paragraphs.text: Good piece. One thing though — I wouldn’t call their young core “solid.” Mirotic and McDermott are enigmas who are wildly inconsistent, Portis has been awful this year, and Valentine has been too injured to tell. I’m also guessing they were a lot higher on Felicio last year given how little he’s shown this year. After drafting brilliantly in the…

11712ae17453.title: So are you guys basically disavowing Tjarks’s positive Bulls piece at the beginning of the year?

paragraphs.text: So are you guys basically disavowing Tjarks’s positive Bulls piece at the beginning of the year? Maybe you don’t expect us to remember, and I guess it doesn’t matter, but it does feel like you’re trying to memory wipe that article he spent time and effort on.

14e813276593.name: Thomas Jenkins

de9224103f22.bio: Former chinese rap star (Yin Ts'ang), now I'm not.
de9224103f22.name: Joshua Heffernan

paragraphs.text: Volcanoes usually provide warnings before eruptions begin, according to volcano experts. Those signs include detectable earthquakes, steam explosions, deformation of the ground surface, and changes to the temperature of the groundwater. In layman’s terms: Scary shit happens. Fortunately, scientists can usually detect warning signs quickly enough to evacuate cities and save lives. Basketball teams aren’t quite as volatile as volcanoes, but signs of a looming cataclysm are just as observable: disgruntled superstars, underachieving rosters, tenuous front-office relationships. The Chicago Bulls are boiling. They’re a drifting 18–18 team on the playoff bubble, coach Fred Hoiberg’s job is reportedly on the line, and Rajon Rondo will seek a trade if he remains benched.
paragraphs.name: aafb
